Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Just now, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> Knowing the way M2X went, Mk3 will likely end up getting both a rocket and jet VTOL engine at some point. Mk3 precooler is also on the to-do list.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> [@OrbitalBuzzsaw](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/158329-orbitalbuzzsaw/): The Pluto/Hades use LF by default. They only use LH2 if you also have NFE/KA installed. If you need LF nukes and you do have them installed, delete the Mk2Expansion/Patches/M2X\_KA.cfg and the Mk3Expansion/patches/M3X\_NFE\_Functionality.cfg
> 

Ahh - Can't live without NF-All-Of-It, but it's causing problems

> 
> 
> On 28.5.2016 at 9:07 AM, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> @kolago: Not sure what the issue is; it's a inline part, it only has nodes on either side, a top node and a bottom node. Can you explain in greater detail please and/or provide a pic of the issue?
> 

Here is a picture.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/k9zf8h1vewkaefn/UT69518_NA_Kerbin_NA-1.jpg?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/k9zf8h1vewkaefn/UT69518_NA_Kerbin_NA-1.jpg?dl=0)

I cant get anything connecting the bottom node.

And the other way around. Cant connecting to top node.

[https://www.dropbox.com/s/eux6itjwcz04miu/UT69518_NA_Kerbin_NA-2.jpg?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/eux6itjwcz04miu/UT69518_NA_Kerbin_NA-2.jpg?dl=0)

You have TweakableEverything, which sees that the inline docking port has an animation and assumes the animation is to cover one of the nodes (like the "shielded" docking port).

[@toadicus](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/67745-toadicus/), this is why I suggested that patch:

<iframe data-embedcontent="" frameborder="0" src="https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/58773-11-tweakableeverything-115-for-all-your-part-tweaking-needs/&do=embed&embedComment=2604769&embedDo=findComment"></iframe>

> 
>

Thanks!
Just found your newest venture SI, I must say its very impressive and a much needed addition to the community.  Bravo and thank you for your contributions to KSP!

[@SuicidalInsanity](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/) I've been using your Mk 2 mod for a while... have made some interesting craft with it. Decided to download the Mk 3 mod (as listed in <abbr title="Comprehensive Kerbal Archive Network (a KSP mod manager)">CKAN</abbr>). If I can make a suggestion without sounding too demanding, I think that a Mk 3 science lab, and even a Mk 3 hydroponics greenhouse (for colonies and space stations) would be a great addition.  I'm always trying to find neat Mk 2 and Mk 3 items - and your mods normally fit my needs nicely. ![:cool:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cool.gif ":cool:")

Thank you for taking the time and effort to make these really great parts!

Oh, here's a peek at one of my newer craft... it is still in development mode as its behavior is not quite what I want. Right now I am having diving/surfacing issues, and am hoping to get them worked out soon.

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/LVoj5/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

<iframe class="imgur-album" frameborder="0" height="550" src="//imgur.com/a/LIySv/embed?background=ffffff&text=1a1a1a&link=4e76c9" width="100%"></iframe>

I'm surprised that nobody reported this by now, but mk3 "Sievert" engine is unusable due to some collider weirdness.

Hi, I just downloaded the mod and one problem I noticed with the Large Wing Panels is that the front end shape of them is not the same as the rear, as in the rear is slightly thicker than the front. This meant I could not build large wings using rows of these large panels. Could you make a variant of each of the wings with the front ends of the panels is the same thickness as the rear ends of the panels? This would be really nice for making those big wings. Yeah, I know B9 has something like this already but B9 doesn't work with other mods so well texture wise.

@Rho-Mu 34: Could have sworn I fixed that in an earlier release. No matter; M3X 1.1.05 is now up on Github which fixes the issue.

@Christian Michael: A consequence of trying to make wing boards that would also work with the stock Big-S delta wing. That said, i do have a overhaul for the wing segments planned for the near future to rework and expand the Big-S wing line-up and fix a few issues with the current parts, including the one you mention.

[@SuicidalInsanity](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/) the 8kn <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> trusters from Mk2 pack aren't responding to <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> Translation controls. They worked fine in 1.1.2, but 1.13 broke them. They still work to turn the shuttle I'm using them on, and MRS's 5-way thrusters worked fine last night for my Mun station. Ideas? 

EDIT - the <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> engines are set to 5-way subtype 

**Edited <time datetime="2016-07-09T20:33:39Z" title="07/09/2016 08:33  PM" data-short="8 yr">July 9, 2016</time> by OrbitalBuzzsaw**

That's very odd. Doesn't respond to translation thrusters how?  A quick test with the 5-way thrusters, and I'm getting full 5-way control with both the IJKLHN flight <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> controls and the docking mode WASDShiftCtrl controls.

It might be some sort of weirdness going on with vessels that were in-flight when the game updated to 1.1.3. Alternatively, I've noticed that when using hyperedit to throw things into orbit for testing it once in a while affects <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> control, though resetting Control From Here on the cockpit fixed the issue. That might be worth a try. Does it occur with newly launched vessels? Does the monoprop variant of the 5-way <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> have the same issue?

Do you think you could add a fuel mode on the banshee fans for <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>/air mode? I would really like to use them with those instead of just <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">Lf</abbr>/Ox as the only purpose, I know they are supposed to be for landing on atmspheric planets without oxygen but it would expand the options of airplane building.

Also the nuclear reactor isn't producing any electrical charge or have any way to turn it on. I have KSPI extended installed so that might be the problem.
Could you possibly add some additional Big-S control surfaces? I always get frustrated trying to use the stock ones with your wing segments.
Now I am going to sound like a total idiot but where do I put this in the KSP folder? Presumably in the game data folder but where exactly?

Progress!

![M609X0W.png](http://i.imgur.com/M609X0W.png)

All appropriate Mk3 engines now have fairings and bottom attach nodes.

@Titan 3000: The Banshee <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patch? Personally I'd name it something like M2X\_AirbreathingBanshee.cfg and either stick it with the rest of the M2X <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> patches in the Mk2Expansion/Patches folder or put it in a MyMMPatches folder for convenience, but <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> .cfgs can be placed anywhere, as long as Gamedata is the root folder.

Big-S wings rework WIP:![fJF0zTI.png](http://i.imgur.com/fJF0zTI.png)I think they turned out fairly well; triangular segment's textures probably not final. The Big-S wings are now more standardized, both in shape and lineup, as well as have the option of being compatible with the stock C7 wing segments. Control surfaces are next. I'm also tempted to add integrated airbrakes to the rectangular wing segments, though it would almost certainly be a better idea to have them separate parts.

> 
>

That might be worth a try. Does it occur with newly launched vessels? That ship was launch in 1.1.3. although it was after a quickload that I did this

just stopping by to say how much I love this (and all your) mod(s). Mk3 is my favorite formfactor and doesn't get enough attention. The stockalike and modsupport of your mods is just phenomenal. Really well done. Kudos!

Only problems I've encountered are a number of small typos, e.g. "this is a very fast and sleep cockpit" type deal (should probably be sleek). I've pretty much gone over the configs line by line, so I've seen all the little bits and bobs that stick out.![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") Pretty minor stuff.

And again, thanks for the NFE support and the rest.

Cheers.
Love the mod, just started using the Hades engine but I can't get it to thrust. The Engine activates and you get engine trails but the thrust remains at 0.00m/s.

> 
> 
> On 7/23/2016 at 4:27 PM, ChobitsCrazy said:
> 
> 
> Love the mod, just started using the Hades engine but I can't get it to thrust. The Engine activates and you get engine trails but the thrust remains at 0.00m/s.
> 

do you have NearFutureElectrical or KerbalAtomics installed?
[@SuicidalInsanity](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/143878-suicidalinsanity/) would Hyperedit do it? or Mechjeb (not active and not on the spacecraft) (OMG Sentient Mechjeb!)

[@OrbitalBuzzsaw](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/158329-orbitalbuzzsaw/): I have had Hyperedit muck with <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> inputs occasionally - in my case teleporting components to a multipart vessel from the launchpad into orbit, and then teleporting them from <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> into a high Munar orbit; going back to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> and returning via tracking station might have been involved as well - and the <abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr> controls would sometimes behave strangely. Resetting vessel controls by right-clicking on the probe core/cockpit controlling the vessel and clicking the Control From Here button fixed the issue.

> 
> 
> Just now, SuicidalInsanity said:
> 
> 
> [@OrbitalBuzzsaw](%7B___base_url___%7D/index.php?/profile/158329-orbitalbuzzsaw/): I have had Hyperedit muck with <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> inputs occasionally - in my case teleporting components to a multipart vessel from the launchpad into orbit, and then teleporting them from <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit"><abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr></abbr> into a high Munar orbit; going back to the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center"><abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr></abbr> and returning via tracking station might have been involved as well - and the <abbr title="Reaction Control System"><abbr title="Reaction Control System">RCS</abbr></abbr> controls would sometimes behave strangely. Resetting vessel controls by right-clicking on the probe core/cockpit controlling the vessel and clicking the Control From Here button fixed the issue.

Launched this one for real
